summary: dixons carphone boss set to leave .

documents.title: good night !
text: that 's all from business live for today and indeed this week - thanks for reading .
as always we are back bright and early on monday at 06:00 so do join us then for all the day 's business news and views .

documents.title: shutdown ? what shutdown ?
text: the s & p 500 and nasdaq have finished at records as wall street investors shrugged off worries about a us government shutdown .
the republican-controlled senate 's bid to avert the shutdown is teetering on the brink of collapse as it races against a midnight deadline .
but the rancour in washington did n't disrupt the wall street rally .
the s & p 500 index finished 0.4 % higher at 2,810.30 points , while the tech-heavy nasdaq gained 0.5 % to 7,336.38 .
the dow jones industrial average also rose , gaining 0.2 % to finish the week at 26,071.00 - slightly below wednesday 's close , when all three indices ended at records .

documents.title: breakingdixons carphone confirms boss departure
text: dixons carphone has confirmed that its chief executive sebastian james is leaving , and will be joining high street chemist boots .
the firm , which owns carphone warehouse and currys pc world , is appointing alex baldock as its new chief executive from april .
mr james has informed the board of his decision to step down around the end of the financial year after six years in the role , the company said .

documents.title: virtual currency operators charged
text: the us derivatives watchdog has filed charges against three separate virtual currency operators , alleging the defendants had defrauded customers and broken other commodity trading rules , in a further sign regulators globally are cracking down on the emerging asset class .

the lawsuits were filed by the commodity futures trading commission and come amid heightened fears globally over the risks that bitcoin and other virtual currencies may pose to investors and the global financial system .

this month the commission and securities and exchange commission this month warned investors about risks posed by virtual currency operators and have both been increasing their jurisdiction over the cryptocurrency market , which has no overriding federal regulator .
this week they issued a joint statement saying both agencies would `` continue to address violations and to bring actions to stop and prevent fraud in the offer and sale of digital instruments '' .

documents.title: who is seb james ?
text: seb james is reportedly leaving dixons carphone to head up high street retailer boots .
he joined dixons in 2008 to help with its transformation into an electronics retailer branded as currys pc world .
when dixons merged with mobile phone retailer carphone warehouse in 2014 , he became chief executive of the joint group .
a friend of david cameron 's , mr james came out in support of remain ( video above ) during the eu referendum in 2016 .
but last year the firm issued two profit warnings and saw its shares fall by 45 % as people shunned expensive mobile phones and held onto their old handsets for longer .

documents.title: dixons carphone boss to leave - reports
text: the chief executive of currys pc world and carphone warehouse is set to leave days before it reports its christmas trading performance , according to sky news .
sebastian james , who runs dixons carphone , is to leave to run high street chemist boots , according to the report .
dixons carphone will publish sales figures for the festive period on tuesday , after issuing a profit warning in december .

documents.title: coca-cola 's recycling vow
text: coca-cola is pledging to recycle a used bottle or can for every one the company sells by 2030 .
calling it a `` massive global ambition '' , the fizzy drinks maker admitted its part in littering the environment and a responsibility to tackle the problem .
the company , which makes hundreds of drinks , juices and water , will also work towards making all of its packaging recyclable worldwide .
greenpeace said coca-cola should focus on reducing , not recycling , waste .

documents.title: norwegian sets transatlantic record
text: the record for the fastest transatlantic flight by a conventional airliner has been broken by a norwegian boeing 787-9 dreamliner , which managed the crossing from new york to gatwick in just five hours and 13 minutes .
the flight , carrying 284 passengers , arrived in london 53 minutes early at 9.57pm on monday .
strong tailwinds over the atlantic pushed the aircraft to a top speed of 776mph during the 3,500-mile flight .
the subsonic record is believed to have previously been held by a british airways boeing 777-200 jet , which took five hours and 16 minutes in 2015 .
the quickest transatlantic passenger flight was set by concorde at two hours and 52 minutes in 1996 .

documents.title: investors bullish on trump
text: institutional investors are overwhelmingly pleased with the performance of the us economy under donald trump 's presidency , according to a new survey .
more than 100 investors , who together manage assets totalling more than $ 6.8tn , responded to fti consulting 's review .
fully 87 % of those polled thought the man in the oval office had successfully created a `` business friendly environment '' at home .
however , 71 % felt that the commander-in-chief had done little to `` promote global economic stability '' .

mr trump , who will face the global business community at the world economic forum in davos next week , has repeatedly taken credit for the strong performance of the us stock market - the dow jones has risen by more than 30 % since he took office .
author: Joe Miller
Business reporter

documents.title: channel bridge is 'very interesting ' , says eurotunnel
text: unless you 've been living under a rock today , it may have been hard to escape the story about boris johnson suggesting a bridge be built across the channel to compliment the tunnel .
the foreign secretary thinks it would be a good way to help bring the uk and france closer together after brexit
anyway , despite downing street being somewhat lukewarm on the idea , eurotunnel says it is `` right to be thinking about '' building a new english channel crossing .
current channel tunnel traffic only runs at about 54 % of total capacity , but the channel tunnel owner has the rights to build any second crossing until 2086 .
john keefe of eurotunnel says : `` it 's a very interesting idea .
we want to be involved if it gets developed , as it gets developed , but we think there is still a bit of growth to do first before it becomes necessary . ''

documents.title: sterling sags
text: the pound fell on friday following the unexpectedly big drop in retail sales last month .
sterling was down around 0.3 % against the us dollar at $ 1.3850 , having climbed as high as $ 1.3940 in morning trading before the figures were released .

it had been gaining ground on a weak dollar as us politicians continue to grapple over a stopgap bill that would avert a government shutdown , but was knocked after the office for national statistics said uk retail sales tumbled 1.5 % month-on-month , marking the worst december performance since 2010 .

lukman otunuga , a research analyst at fxtm , said rising inflation combined with tepid wage growth had sapped consumer spending power : `` it is becoming clear that sterling 's appreciation this month had nothing to do with a change of sentiment towards the uk economy , but rather ongoing dollar weakness and market optimism over a soft brexit . ''

documents.title: kier takes on 200 carillion workers
text: construction firm kier is offering jobs to about 200 former carillion workers on joint venture contracts .
on the hs2 rail project , kier and eiffage are now 50/50 joint venture partners , delivering two of the seven civil engineering packages .
all 51 carillion employees , including apprentices , have been offered the opportunity to join kier/eiffage with continuous service being maintained .
kier has assumed full responsibility for a £ 475m highways england motorways programme , on which about 150 workers will join kier in the next week - including seven apprentices .

documents.title: digestives set to shrink
text: the humble packet of mcvitie 's digestives are set to shrink by 20 % , from 500 to 400 grams , this month .
`` the rising cost of ingredients and changes in the exchange rates means it has become more expensive to bake our products , '' said nick bunker of pladis , which owns the brand .
the company denied the change was the result of one specific event such as the brexit vote , but rather a response to `` changing market conditions and the increased cost of ingredients '' .
the pro-eu campaign group open britain said : `` this really takes the biscuit . ''
pladis suggests retailers drop the price of the packets from 10p to £ 1.15 to reflect the new size .

documents.title: ambulances not cavalry : the carillion response
text: in the government 's defence , it is doubtful that a £ 150m last-minute bung to carillion would have made any difference to the final outcome - such was the graveness of this ever-optimistic company 's condition .
this was first and foremost a private company failure exposing greedy and incompetent management .
how else to describe an ever-increasing dividend policy for a company with serious cash flow problems and a rising pension deficit ?
how else to describe the attempts of management to make it harder to claw back bonuses in the event of the company going bust ?
read more from simon here .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: rbs helps carillion customers
text: more on carillion .
rbs says it is offering a range of flexible options to support its customers who worked for carillion or companies in the supply chain .
the move is targeted at customers who may be at risk of falling behind on mortgage or loan repayments , or incurring bank charges .
the support is available to customers banking with natwest , royal bank of scotland and ulster bank in northern ireland .
a statement said measures could include : `` on request , and for three months , we 'll give impacted customers a repayment holiday on their loan or mortgage .
where a customer needs to withdraw savings funds and a fee will apply , we will waive that fee . ''

documents.title: 'some respite '
text: mick cash , general secretary of the rail , maritime and transport union , says the network rail announcement on carillion is `` some respite '' for its members .

however , there is no commitment on sub-contractors ' wages and no commitment as to whether directly employed staff or sub-contractors who worked throughout christmas and new year will receive those payments .
the cash has already been paid over to carillion , but no promise to pay the workers has been given and that needs to be sorted out urgently .
the employment and pension status of carillion staff has also not been established and rmt will be seeking assurances that pension contributions issues are addressed . ''

documents.title: ftse ends higher
text: london 's blue-chip ftse 100 has ended 0.4 % higher at 7,730 points , with easyjet the day 's biggest riser - up 4.6 % .
b & q owner kingfisher shed 2.7 % , making it the day 's top faller .
over on the ftse 250 , funeral firm dignity has closed down a stonking 49 % - one of the biggest one-day falls for a company on the mid-cap index we can remember at business live towers .

documents.title: carillion rail deal
text: employees of carillion working on network rail projects will have their wages guaranteed to at least mid-april .

the official receiver 's special managers , pwc , and network rail have come to an agreement that ensures pwc can pay wages for work on network rail 's projects until after easter , and have also made arrangements to ensure rail employees are paid as normal in january .

`` carillion construction employees working on network rail projects are encouraged to turn up for work as normal and continue to deliver their rail work and projects , secure in the knowledge that they will be paid by pwc for the work they do , '' network rail said .

text: shares in fever-tree are still almost 10 % higher amid rumours that the posh soft drinks maker is being targeted for a takeover .
it followed reports suggesting consumer goods giant unilever , along with diageo and pernod ricard , may be weighing up a bid for the fast-growing firm that is worth £ 2.7bn .
fever-tree sells mixers such as ginger beer and sicilian lemonade and has recently signalled its intent to conquer the us market .

documents.title: amazon hikes prime pricing
text: amazon is raising the monthly charge for its prime service by $ 2 to $ 12.99 in the us , although the annual fee is staying at $ 99 .
the online retailer last raised its annual fee for its delivery and video service , by 25 % , in 2014 .
amazon prime is a key growth driver for the company as members tend to buy more .
it 's also a very healthy moneyspinner , raking in $ 2.4bn for the quarter to 30 september .
a spokesperson said there were no plans to raise prices in the uk .

documents.title: dignity stiffed
text: shares in dignity are still down about 50 % on the ftse 250 this afternoon after the company said its annual results would be `` substantially below '' market expectations .
in the face of stiff competition , dignity said it would overhaul its pricing strategy , cutting the cost of dignity 's basic funeral by 25 % .
however , russ mould , aj bell investment director , said its pre-arranged and crematoria businesses were performing strongly and in line with forecasts .
that has not been enough to stop investors dumping the stock , which is down 953p to 962p .

documents.title: wall street opens higher
text: wall street has opened higher for the final day of the week , putting the major indexes on track for three consecutive weeks of gains as hopes of a strong results season overshadowed fears of a potential us government shutdown .
the dow jones industrial average rose 12 points to 26,030 , the s & p 500 gained 6 points to 2,804 while the nasdaq composite added 23 points to 7,319 .

documents.title: merkel to speak at davos
text: another big name has been added to the davos guest list .
german chancellor angela merkel is set to deliver a keynote speech on europe at the annual economic forum next week .
it comes as mrs merkel struggles to cobble together a working coalition after last september 's inconclusive elections .
she will speak on wednesday - but is set to leave before us president donald trump arrives at the swiss ski resort .
among the other high-profile speakers slated for the five-day event are theresa may , emmanuel macron , narendra modi and justin trudeau .

documents.title: us regulator sues three virtual currency operators
text: the commodity futures trading commission ( cftc ) - the us derivatives watchdog - has filed charges against three separate virtual currency operators .
the lawsuits allege that the defendants have defrauded customers and broken other commodity trading rules .
the move is a sign that the us government is cracking down on cryptocurrencies , following rules put in place by other countries including china , japan , south korea , russia and taiwan .

documents.title: asda and aldi stop energy drink sales to under-16s
text: asda and aldi are to ban the sale of energy drinks to children under 16 from early march .
their move comes after waitrose announced that customers buying drinks after 5 march could be asked to show id .
asda has become the first of the `` big four '' supermarkets to announce an age limit , which will apply to 84 high-caffeine drinks .
aldi will apply it to soft drinks containing 150mg of caffeine per litre .

documents.title: softbank closes uber deal
text: japanese telecommunications giant softbank is now the largest stakeholder in the controversial ride-hailing app firm uber .
the $ 1.25bn investment from a group led by softbank means uber is now valued at about $ 48bn , despite its huge losses .
softbank , which has a focus on artificial intelligence , will be able to share its resources and expertise with uber , which has been researching ai for autonomous vehicles .

documents.title: thyssenkrupp needs government consent to make changes
text: engineering firm thyssenkrupp will require express consent from the german government before it is able to make strategic changes to its submarine unit , its chief executive heinrich hiesinger has told shareholders .

the firm said that the low earnings of the marine systems unit , which is part of the group 's struggling industrial solutions division , significantly hit the adjusted operating profit of the whole division .
the marine systems unit will be examined during thyssenkrupp 's annual strategic review .

documents.title: ftse 100 heading higher
text: while it might be a bleak day for some shares - with carpetright , bonmarche and dignity all suffering hefty falls - the benchmark ftse 100 index has gained steadily through the morning and is now up 19.61 points at 7,720.57 .
however , the near halving of funeral firm dignity 's share price has not helped the ftse 250 , of which dignity is a member .
the mid-cap index is down 21.52 points at 20,643.50 .
carpetright shares are still down 44 % after its profit warning , while shares in bonmarche stand 22.5 % lower after it reported a sharp drop in sales at its stores .

documents.title: police probe 'poor ' pension advice for british steel workers
text: police are looking into reports that port talbot steelworkers have been given poor pensions advice .
tata steel employees have claimed they have been mis-sold advice about moving from the british steel pension scheme after it was removed from the business .
the uk 's financial regulator , the financial conduct authority is already investigating 17 firms over their handling of the issue .
south wales police said it was `` reviewing certain information that has been brought to our attention '' .
some workers claim they have been advised to move to schemes which would leave them worse off .
you can read more on the story here .

documents.title: fever-tree fizzing after bid rumour
text: shares are fizzing at the upmarket maker of tonic water and other mixers , fever-tree .
rumours have spread through the city that the company could be on the end of a bid from consumer goods giant unilever .
it follows news that fever-tree has appointed kevin havelock , unilever 's global president of refreshment , as a non-executive director last week .
investors seem to be taking the speculation seriously , marking up fever-tree shares by 11 % in late morning trading .

documents.title: uk consumers bought less food in december 2017
text: it has been widely reported that , although consumers spent less on christmas gifts in 2017 , they were treating themselves to more expensive food .
it 's a trend that saw several supermarkets report positive trading figures .
yet , latest official retail figures show that , overall , people are buying less food .

`` while the uk 's leading grocers have reported relatively robust trading in the run-up to christmas , overall the performance of the grocers has been weaker than many expected , with today 's figures showing that the uk bought less food than last year , '' said ian geddes , head of retail at deloitte .
ons figures show that more money was spent in non-food than any other sector .
however , given the amount of promotional activity during the festive period , how profitable these retailers have been over christmas remains a question . ''

documents.title: a disappointing end to 2017 for retailers
text: it 's always tricky looking at one month 's set of retail figures .
although december saw a bigger than expected dip than the previous month , it 's been clear for some time that the pattern of christmas spending is changing .
black friday has been hugely disruptive , bringing forward consumer spending that would otherwise have taken place in the traditional month of december .
so that 's had a knock-on effect on today 's figures .
the british retail consortium 's the other day figures posted a bit of month-on-month growth .
for a clearer sense of the underlying trend , you need to look at retail sales over a longer period .
perhaps the most interesting stat in today 's data is the slowing growth between the fourth quarter of 2017 and the previous one .
in other words , a disappointing end to a tough year for retailers .
author: Emma Simpson
Business correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: m & s may have put bonmarche under pressure
text: although bonmarche worked hard to reverse its run of poor trading by modernising its products and stores , its like-for-like christmas sales were the worst of all clothing retailers to have reported so far in 2018 .

`` its results this morning reflect some of the struggle endured by those mass market retailers targeting an older demographic , though it is clear that bonmarche missed the mark in appealing to gift buyers and premiumising some of its offer to draw in those wanting to trade up , '' said honor strachan , principal retail analyst at globaldata .

`` though m & s has its own issues , it will have put added pressure on bonmarche this christmas following the price decreases it initiated throughout 2017 , with shoppers perhaps switching to the midmarket high street stalwart for perceived better quality and the brand name - both important sales drivers over the christmas trading period . ''

documents.title: sterling on a seesaw
text: the pound is now up 0.15 % against the dollar at $ 1.39150 , after falling on ons data showing british retail sales fell by more than expected in december - the lowest annual retail sales growth since 2013 .
sterling is also down 0.19 % on the euro at €1.13300 .

sterling bulls have been roaring all week with the uk currency sailing along at a post brexit-vote high , but this morning 's latest gauge of consumer spending is likely to put the brakes on any further gains , '' said dennis de jong , managing director at ufx.com .
the key to stabilising the currently volatile cable will be upcoming trade negotiations between london and brussels . ''
he added : `` following today 's retail sales data the $ 1.40 mark looks out of reach , and there are likely to be some unwanted twists and turns on the path to brexit in the coming months .
overall , the pound remains a risky investment . ''

documents.title: carillion sub-contractors 'unlikely to get anything at all '
text: yesterday several uk banks approved an emergency fund to support small business customers who are struggling after the failure of carillion .
however mike cherry , chairman of the federation of small businesses , does n't think the funds , which total about £ 225m , will do much to help .
`` [ the emergency fund ] is only going to be a sticking plaster trying to help those that are viable for continuing business and recover from this in time , '' he told the today programme .

`` we all need to understand that whilst we 've been calling for businesses to be paid out of this mess , it is very unlikely , as in any liquidation , that those who have already invoiced carillion up until the announcement on monday are going to get anything at all . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'payback for the black friday splurge '
text: samuel tombs , chief uk economist at pantheon macroeconomics , says that december 's plunge in retail sales simply reflects the fact that more people are now doing their christmas shopping mostly in november to take advantage of black friday discounts .
`` december 's drop means that quarter-on-quarter growth in retail sales volumes slowed to 0.4 % in q4 , from 0.8 % in q3 , '' he said .
`` the retail sector accounts for only 6 % of economy-wide output , but its slowdown has been mirrored by other sectors , such as construction .
accordingly , we still think that gdp growth likely slowed to 0.3 % in q4 , from 0.4 % in q3 . ''

documents.title: 'a generational shift in purchasing patterns '
text: alex marsh , managing director of close brothers retail finance says that there has been `` a generational shift in purchasing patterns '' , in response to the latest ons retail figures .

older consumers remained committed to the traditional boxing day sales taking the opportunity to purchase furniture , while younger people took advantage of the earlier black friday sales as the day for purchasing electronics and gadgets , '' said alex marsh , managing director of close brothers retail finance .
`` although retailers had a busy december , january is likely to see reduced consumer spending as financial resolutions are imposed and real wages continue to shrink . ''
he thinks that in order to get consumers to spend more on big ticket items , retailers may consider offering consumers alternative flexible payment options including spreading the cost of purchases .

documents.title: no ministers met carillion
text: this morning 's financial times is reporting that no senior uk government ministers met with carillion in the months after its first profit warning in july last year .
the government went ahead and awarded six more contracts , despite concerns over the firm 's financial health .

the ft says `` whitehall 's departmental transparency data show that between july and september , there were no meetings between carillion and any ministers from the cabinet office , the department for transport or the ministry of defence .
data for september to december has not yet been published . ''

documents.title: asia markets end week on a high
text: the key asian markets have ended another upbeat week on a strong note .
hong kong 's hang seng index ended at yet another a new high , adding 132.95 points or 0.4 % at 32,254.9 .
that took the week 's gains to 2.7 % .
meanwhile tokyo stocks also closed higher , with the nikkei 225 index putting on 0.2 % to finish at 23,808 points .

documents.title: a380 'saved ' by emirates deal
text: airbus has secured a $ 16bn deal to provide 36 new airbus a380 superjumbo jets to dubai-based airline emirates .
`` it 's definitely a life-line for aeroplanes - for both companies , '' bbc 's business news reporter theo leggett told bbc business live .
`` emirates runs more a380s than anybody else .
they suit its business model , which is transporting huge numbers of people over great distances .
from airbus ' point of view , they needed another order to keep the production lines going , because they do n't have a big backlog . ''
the deal enables airbus to keep producing a380s for the next decade , during which time the aerospace industry is expected to grow exponentially .

he added : `` at the end of that period , airports will begin to get more congested , and the business case for the a380 - which is n't really there at the moment - may start to look a lot more logical . ''
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: carpetright and dignity shares crash on open
text: shares at troubled carpet retailer carpetright have plummeted an epic 44.7 % or 73.5 points to 91p after reporting disappointing post-christmas trading figures .
the ftse 100 has opened flat , down just 0.06 % or 4.6 points to 7,696.32 .
womenswear retailer bonmarche has fallen 18.6 % to 103p on disappointing christmas trading figures .
funeral provider dignity has also seen its shares sink 53 % to 900p after issuing a profit alert .
kingfisher heads the losers , falling 1.8 % to 337.7p , while easyjet leads the winners , rising 2.6 % to £ 15.52 .
the ftse 250 meanwhile is down 0.2 % or 39.8 points to 20,625.22 .
funeral provider dignity is top of the losers , down 41.3 % to £ 11.25 after issuing a profit warning .

documents.title: bonmarche reports disappointing sales
text: womenswear retailer bonmarche has reported disappointing sales for the christmas trading period .
the retailer saw its like-for-like sales for the 13 weeks ended 30 dec were 5.5 % down on the previous year .
store like-for-like sales were down by 9.7 % , but online sales increased by 28.5 % .
bonmarche said that its forecast for the full year still remains in line with previous expectations .

`` the clothing market became more challenging during this quarter , especially on the high street ; consequently our store like-for-like was disappointing , '' said bonmarche 's chief executive helen connolly .

`` 'we do not anticipate material changes in the underlying market conditions , and in this short term outlook , the weather represents the most significant uncertainty due to its effect on consumer shopping behaviour , with the risks equally weighted on the up and downsides . ''

documents.title: funeral firm dignity issues profit alert
text: dignity - the uk 's only funeral company with shares listed on the london stock market - has said profits this year are likely to be `` substantially below '' expectations as it struggles with a price war in the sector .
the company says it has been losing market share , with customers shopping around in an `` over-supplied industry '' .
as a result , dignity is cutting the price of its simple funeral plan by about 25 % , and freezing prices of its traditional funerals in most of its locations .

documents.title: duterte gets tough on airport baggage handlers
text: if airport workers rifle through your luggage and steals things , you 're going to get upset .
but you probably do n't expect your country 's president to get involved .
then again , rodrigo duterte is not your usual head of state .
the philippines leader is renowned for being tough on drug dealers ( the general policy is 'kill them ' ) is now turning his ire on the corporate world .
reports say he has told ministers to end the contract of miascor - one of the country 's biggest aviation ground handling firms - after just such an incident .
`` i would demand that there will be justice instantly .
whoever is the service provider , you terminate the contract and look for another one , '' he is reported to have said .
miascor is yet to comment .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: cash machine warning
text: the consumer group , which ? , are on the case of the cash machines because link - which manages the network - wants to reduce the amount it charges banks and building societies to use its machines by 20 % over the next four years , from 25p to 20p per transaction .
this would make it less profitable to run an atm in many areas .
link says this will control runaway growth in the number of atms , and preserve them where they are needed .
but which ?
says it will see `` mass closures '' of free-to-use machines .

documents.title: carillion apprentices need new sponsors
text: there 's a shortage of skilled labour in the construction industry .
so those with qualifications in bricklaying , carpentry and joinery should be able to find new jobs if the collapse of carillion has cost them their present one .
but what of those who are still in the process of acquiring the necessary skills ?

sarah beale from the construction industry training board ( citb ) has told bbc radio 4 's today programme that by the end of today , the training body will have had face-to-face meetings with 900 of the 1,400 apprentices affected by the collapse of carillion .
she thinks even those part-way through training have a `` very , very positive '' outlook .
`` already companies have proactively come forward - all different sizes of companies .
my plea now is to ask other construction companies to come forward if they can provide any support or employment opportunities for these very talented individuals . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: carpetright affected by 'changing consumer trends '
text: according to neil wilson , a senior market analyst with etx capital , carpetright 's troubles are due to it failing to adapt to changing consumer trends .
`` lower footfall has left transaction numbers down significantly from last year , '' he said .
we must also consider weaker consumer sentiment for big ticket items as a factor , as well tougher competition from a more diverse marketplace . ''
he expects carpetright 's shares to take a beating today and sink below the december 2016 low .

documents.title: 'delivered food more popular than ever before '
text: david wild , the chief executive of pizza delivery firm domino 's pizza , says that food delivered to the home has never been more popular than it is today .
in december , a domino 's store opening in the north of scotland set a world record for the most sales generated by any franchise store in the world .
`` we 're a trade-up from cooking at home , and a trade-down from eating in a restaurant , '' mr wild told wake up to money .
`` people are happy to eat in the home , because in-house entertainments are so much better than they 've ever been before . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: carpetright warns on profits
text: floor coverings specialist carpetright has cut its forecast for full-year profits after suffering a `` sharp deterioration '' in uk trade .
it said trading in the key post-christmas period had been `` significantly behind expectations '' .
in the 11 weeks to 13 january , like-for-like sales - which strip out the impact of store openings or closures - fell 3.6 % in the uk .
carpetright now expects full-year profits to be between £ 2m and £ 6m , compared with previous estimates from analysts of about £ 14m .

documents.title: cash machine warning
text: research from the consumer group which ?
has found there are 200 postcodes in uk with little to no atm access .
which ?
analysed data on 70,000 cash machines across the uk .
it found that 123 postcode districts - with a combined population of well over 100,000 - did not appear to contain a single atm .

david cavell , retail banking consultant , tells bbc breakfast these were still a vital service : `` there are alternative methods of making payments but these are not fully understood at the moment .
`` there are 48 million people still using cash machines . ''
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: the battle to tackle insider trading
text: according to the times , insider trading is rife in the city , and there have been fewer than 10 prosecutions for insider trading in the past five years by the financial conduct authority ( fca ) .
`` we do some lawsuits come through , but clearly not enough .

it seems to be a focus of the fca , but whether it 's filtering through into practices , clearly not , '' henrietta grimston , an investment advisor at seven investment management told the wake up to money programme .
`` it 's harder to assess individuals in the business , but the fca has taken some steps to make people more accountable . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: hsbc to pay $ 101.5m to settle currency rigging probe
text: hsbc has agreed to pay $ 101.1m ( £ 72.7m ) to settle a us criminal investigation into rigged currency transactions .
the bank has admitted its traders twice misused confidential information provided to them by clients for its own profit .
hsbc , which is europe 's biggest bank , saw one of its former bankers convicted last year in connection with the probe .
a us jury found mark johnson guilty of defrauding client cairn energy in a 2011 currency trade .

documents.title: future of carillion construction contracts still unclear
text: since the meltdown of carillion , the government has been meeting with the unions , banks and construction industry to try to solve the crisis - in particular easing the load on sub-contractors caught in the middle .

according to bbc 's business correspondent jonty bloom , much is being done on the services side , whereby contracts are being taken over or funding provided , and on thursday , several banks approved emergency funds for the small businesses affected .
however , there still remains a question mark on the construction side .
`` carillion was part of a consortium on quite a few building projects , and as a rule , if one company goes bust , the others are expected to take over , '' he told the today programme .
`` but with carillion being the second-largest construction company in the uk , the construction industry lacks the ability to handle these large projects . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: bitcoin bubble bursts for the fourth time
text: this week , bitcoin traded below $ 10,000 for the first time since early december , which is a fall of over 53 % .
however , experts warn that the cryptocurrency is so volatile that this is the fourth time the bubble has burst , and that volatility is n't going to go away .

`` it is very difficult to value bitcoin - it 's a completely different asset class , people call it a commodity , but unlike the price of oil or gold , as the price goes up , there is n't really a way to increase the supply , '' cryptocurrency researcher dr garrick hileman told bbc radio 4 's today programme .
`` people start digging for more gold as the price of gold goes up and that new supply affects the price , but nothing like that happens for bitcoin . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: ibm 's revenues up for first time in six years
text: tech giant ibm has reported its first rise in quarterly revenue in close to six years .
the firm has seen a turnaround in fortunes after investing in markets like cloud computing , ai , blockchain and security .
revenues rose to $ 22.5bn ( £ 16.17bn ) in the three months to december , slightly ahead of expectations of $ 22.05bn .
but in terms of net income for the period , big blue , as the firm is affectionately known , posted a loss of $ 1.1bn due to a one-off tax charge related to reforms of the us tax code .
a year earlier it posted a profit of $ 4.5bn .

documents.title: should flexible working become a norm ?
text: this morning , bbc radio 5 live is discussing whether the concept of flexible working should become a norm .
sarah jackson , the chief executive of work-life balance charity working families , believes that human resource departments need to change the way that they recruit for staff .

`` each individual manager has to think about the role before they advertise it , so you 're not just trying to get the right person for the right job , but also the job that fits the right person , '' she told the wake up to money programme .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

text: welcome to friday 's business live page .
today , the office for national statistics will be releasing new statistics on uk retail sales for december .
we 'll also continue our coverage of how the carillion meltdown is affecting various regions across the country , and we 'll look at how the volatile cryptocurrency bitcoin is doing .
stay tuned !
